    Function to generate graph analysis plots

    plot_graph_rankings.Rd

    This function will produce plots of graph analysis of predicted gene regulatory networks. It takes in the output of run_tf_aen and generates graph and ranking plots of top TFs. It calculates two centrality measures, betweenness and PageRank, to determine most central TFs to plot. In order to prioritize TFs that are central, rather than targets, for PageRank, edges are reversed. The function returns a graph and ranking plot for each measure of centrality.

    Usage

    plot_graph_rankings(
  tf_results,
  regulator_tf_names,
  seurat,
  top_n_graph = 20,
  top_n_ranking = 25,
  layout_algorithm = "kk",
  color = "#5862AD"
)

    Arguments

    tf_results

    List output returned by run_tf_aen with trained model information

    regulator_tf_names

    List of TFs with motif and expression information in dataset

    top_n_graph

    Number of most central TFs to plot on gene regulatory network graph plots

    top_n_ranking

    Number of most central TFs to plot on ranking plots

    layout_algorithm

    Algorithm used to construct gene regulatory network graphs. Options are star, circle, gem, dh, graphopt, grid, mds, randomly, fr, drl, lgl, and kk

    color

    Color of points on ranking plots

    Value

    list of plots, two graphs with top TFs by betweenness or PageRank labeled and two ranking plots of top TFs by betweenness or PageRank
